episodes.title: Iron Pulse Rebellion
episodes.description: A techno-city powered by divine engines edges toward collapse and open revolt. Hit checkpoints to earn new cards.

neon_flicker.title: Neon Flicker
neon_flicker.content: Above the techno-city, divine engines cough light into smog. A rebel frequency slips into your comm: 'We can shut it down ‚Äî if you choose a side.'

safehouse.title: Undergrid Safehouse
safehouse.content: The rebels hide beneath coolant pipes and prayer-wires. Their leader hands you a schematic: sabotage the engine, or hijack it.

control_tower.title: Control Tower
control_tower.content: Order officers offer you a badge and a lie: 'The engines are stable.' Behind glass, you see the truth ‚Äî a divine core screaming in static.

engine_chamber.title: Divine Engine Chamber
engine_chamber.content: The engine is alive ‚Äî not with fire, but with a borrowed god. It offers you power in exchange for control. The city waits for your decision.

ending_blackout.title: Ending: City Blackout
ending_blackout.content: The lights die. The engines go silent. The city survives ‚Äî but the streets belong to whoever moves first. You walk away with sparks on your hands.

ending_reform.title: Ending: Pulse Reform
ending_reform.content: You stabilize the core and split its output. Rebels and order are forced to negotiate. The city wakes up to a future that isn‚Äôt owned by one side.

ending_tyrant.title: Ending: Engine Tyrant
ending_tyrant.content: You take the engine‚Äôs voice and make it yours. The city kneels ‚Äî at first. Then it learns your name like a curse.
